forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 60. West wind around 8 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny, with a high near 67. West southwest wind 5 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

weather_report:
As the night drapes its cool embrace over Downtown San Francisco, the skyline is cloaked in a gentle blanket of clouds. The low temperature of around 60 degrees brings a serene stillness, softened only by the whisper of the west wind at about 8 miles per hour. When dawn breaks, the city will awaken to a day of partial sun and a mild high near 67 degrees, accompanied by wind gusts that may dance up to 21 mph, teasing the edges of lightweight jackets.

Looking out with quiet anticipation, one can sense the omnipresent marine layer that often blankets the bay in fog, lending an almost ethereal quality to the Golden Gate. It is a typical San Francisco morning, one where the fog rolls in, perhaps conspiring to hide the view of the bustling city below. As the fog begins to lift, moments of clarity will break through, inviting a stroll along the waterfront or a quiet morning coffee at a local café, where ideas can flow as freely as the water lapping at the shore. Dressing in layers will be key; a light sweater or a windbreaker will offer comfort throughout the day, allowing for transitions between warmth and chill. As the hours drift by, take a moment to explore nearby hidden gems—the quiet corners of the Presidio or the vibrant energy of a local market, where the spirit of the city unfolds at a leisurely pace.
